summary: The diff implements the core VitaSense landing/auth/dashboard/profile + health log flows and a themed UI, plus a static “Future AI Insights” page. No clear missing REQ items are provable from the provided diff summary, but several unrequested features were added (notably access control/admin token plumbing and a promotional footer link).

hallucinated_features.description: Backend access control / authorization system (roles like #user/admin checks) added around profile and health log endpoints, plus an initialization method invoked from the frontend using a secret token.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest REQ-3/REQ-5 did not request authorization/roles/admin-token initialization; it only required per-principal storage and CRUD/upsert endpoints.
evidence: backend/main.mo (imports MixinAuthorization, AccessControl; permission checks/traps in getCallerUserProfile/saveCallerUserProfile/createHealthLogEntry/getHealthLogEntries)
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts (calls actor._initializeAccessControlWithSecret(adminToken) and reads caffeineAdminToken from URL)

hallucinated_features.description: Footer includes a promotional/attribution link to caffeine.ai with referral parameters.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by any REQ; user-facing content was specified around VitaSense branding and medical disclaimers, not external promotional links.
evidence: frontend/src/App.tsx (footer: “Built with ♥ using caffeine.ai” with external link)

hallucinated_features.description: Dark-mode/system theme switching via next-themes ThemeProvider.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-7 asks for a coherent theme; it does not request adding next-themes or system theme switching specifically.
evidence: frontend/src/App.tsx (imports ThemeProvider from 'next-themes' and wraps the app)
